items.title: New York City Residents Will Soon Have to Compost Their Food Scraps
items.abstract: The City Council passed a bill on Thursday requiring New Yorkers to separate their food waste from regular trash, with mandatory composting coming to all five boroughs by next year.

items.title: Priced Out of the City, They Bought a Tiny Suburban Home. Now What?
items.abstract: The 900-square-foot house had three bedrooms, but the children’s were shoe-box size. Updating them required ingenuity and ideas from “An American in Paris.”

items.title: Robin Guenther, Architect of Healthy Hospitals, Dies at 68
items.abstract: Supporting the use of nontoxic construction materials, she co-wrote the first guide to building green health care facilities and designed them to be less austere.

items.title: Design Advice for a Less Toxic Life
items.abstract: Advice on healthy candles, purging kitchen plastic and the art of dyeing fabric naturally.

items.title: An Architect Known for Building Castles in the ‘Vegetable Kingdom’
items.abstract: A man of many hats, Emilio Ambasz practiced green architecture long before it was fashionable.
